title: Doug Tewell
text:
Douglas Fred Tewell (born August 27, 1949) is an American <a href="professional%20golfer">professional golfer</a> who has won several tournaments at both the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> and <a href="Champions%20Tour">Champions Tour</a> level, including two <a href="Senior%20major%20golf%20championships">senior major championships</a>.
Tewell was born in <a href="Baton%20Rouge%2C%20Louisiana">Baton Rouge, Louisiana</a> and reared in <a href="Stillwater%2C%20Oklahoma">Stillwater, Oklahoma</a>. He got started in the game by working as a caddie for his father. He attended <a href="Oklahoma%20State%20University">Oklahoma State University</a> in his hometown on a <a href="basketball">basketball</a> scholarship his freshman year, but later switched to <a href="golf">golf</a>. Tewell graduated and turned pro in 1971.
Tewell joined the PGA Tour in 1975; his best year came in 1980 when he won the <a href="Sea%20Pines%20Heritage">Sea Pines Heritage</a> and <a href="IVB-Golf%20Classic">IVB-Golf Classic</a>. He won two more times on the Tour in the mid-1980s. His best finishes in a <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> were T-9 at the 1983 <a href="PGA%20Championship">PGA Championship</a> and T-10 at the 1986 PGA Championship. Tewell was forced off the PGA Tour at the age of 46 at the end of the 1995 season due to an orthopedic problem in his left <a href="Elbow-joint">elbow</a>. He had arthroscopic surgery on the same elbow in 2005, a procedure he describes as "cleaning out scar tissue".
The biggest win in his career was his first on the Champions Tour. He won his first <a href="Senior%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a>, the <a href="Senior%20PGA%20Championship">Senior PGA Championship</a> at the <a href="PGA%20National%20Resort%20%26amp%3B%20Spa">PGA National Resort & Spa</a> in <a href="Palm%20Beach%20Gardens%2C%20Florida">Palm Beach Gardens, Florida</a> by seven shots over four other players including <a href="Tom%20Kite">Tom Kite</a> and <a href="Hale%20Irwin">Hale Irwin</a>.
Tewell lives today in <a href="Edmond%2C%20Oklahoma">Edmond, Oklahoma</a> with his wife Pam. They have a daughter, Kristie, and a son, Jay. Kristie is married to former <a href="Nationwide%20Tour">Nationwide Tour</a> player <a href="Pat%20Bates">Pat Bates</a>.
Professional wins.
PGA Tour wins (4).
PGA Tour playoff record (1–0)
Champions Tour wins (8).
Champions Tour playoff record (1–1)
